name: (2E)-1,3-benzothiazol-2-yl[(4-chlorophenyl)hydrazono]ethanenitrile
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-1084
Reason: 1,3-Benzothiazole base, with a melting point around 106 degrees Celsius. The chlorine atom introduces a significant dipole, increasing intermolecular forces and melting point by approximately +50 degrees Celsius. The phenyl group contributes to the melting point due to its ability to enhance π-π interactions and overall molecular rigidity. Each phenyl group may contribute around +30 to +50°C. The hydrazono-thiadiazole conjugated system introduces additional rigid structures that can participate in dipole interactions and potentially hydrogen bonding, further raising the melting point by about +70°C. The moramide-like bridging moiety introduces additional rigid structures that can participate in dipole interactions and potentially hydrogen bonding, further raising the melting point by about +30°C. The presence of a dioxane-like bridging moiety also adds rigidity and likely contributes more significantly than a simple ether, estimated at around +5 °C for this structural feature.
